summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, transmitting a corrected production of discovery materials on a CD via FedEx. The email includes attached cover letters.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The recipient of discovery materials in her criminal case; referenced as the defendant in the correspondence.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, transmitting corrected discovery materials to Maxwell's defense team from the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Prosecutor transmitting discovery materials to the defendant as part of the legal process.

events.title: Discovery Production to Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends a corrected production of discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell via FedEx on a CD.

locations.name: Southern District of New York
locations.context: The federal district where the prosecution is based.

locations.name: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
locations.context: The address of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, the sender's location.

keyFacts: On December 18, 2020, the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York sent a corrected production of discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell.
The discovery was transmitted on a CD via FedEx, with accompanying cover letters attached to the email.
This correspondence indicates ongoing pre-trial evidence sharing in Maxwell's criminal case at that time.
